Current Medications[7]
There were no vitals taken for this visit.
Assessment and Plan
ASSESSMENT: s/p stroke in March still some right sided weakness. Lives with his wife both on disability. Dm2, HLD on statin, HTN (since 30s), CKD-3b (Bcr 1.7-2.1), CAD, anxiety/ depression on prozac, cocaine abuse, ED, left hydrocelectomy (1/12/24-Dr. Pryor), white coat syndrome, BPH, GERD on PPI. Pt states he doesn't drink enough water and has a high sodium diet with a salt shaker on the table and using Lowrys to cook. Labs reviewed. Encouraged low Na diet and reading food labels. Increase water intake and stay active. Pt states he is taking meds regularly and checks bp at home.

Weight History per patient:
Nutrition Goals per day for Kidney Health:
Calories: 1700-2000 calories/day
Protein: 55-65 gms/day
Sodium: >1500 mg < 2300 mg/day
Fluid: No restriction at this time
Phosphorus: 1000 mg/day (avoiding phosphate additives, decrease processed food in diet and decrease eating out)
Potassium: 2500 mg/day
24 hour food recall:
BREAKFAST: grits and eggs or fast food breakfast
LUNCH: sandwich with turkey, chips
DINNER: mashed potatoes and meatloaf
SNACKS: none
Bev- water, mountain dew, coffee
Meals cook at home: most meals
Type of meals when eating out: sometimes
PLAN:
Nutrition Recommendations with goal of preserving kidney function:
Track food intake: to work towards meeting nutritional goals for CKD Stage 3b by keeping food diary or using food tracker ie: cronometer
Calories: established to promote weight gain or stable weight. Weight loss/weight gain goal is 1/2-1# per week. Start/Increase exercise as tolerated to goal of 150 minutes per week. Educated the importance of adding health fats to meet calorie goals while decreasing protein intake.
3. Protein: decrease intake to protein goal by decreasing overall animal protein/type -chicken fish over red meat/shellfish/processed meats/organ meats and to add plant-based protein to meet protein goal. Choosing un-enriched milk/dairy alternatives to further decrease animal protein in diet
4. Sodium: intake to goal by decreasing processed foods, decrease
eating out and adding herbs and seasonings over salt (avoid salt
substitute) If not meeting sodium goal can add salt to cooking measure out amount using, It can add up quickly- 1/4 tsp of Salt contains 589.5 mg Sodium.
5. Fluid: no restriction at this time, adequate water intake important for kidney health. Read labels of all bottled drinks to avoid
phosphate additives and potassium additives.
(Only restrict fluid if MD has ordered this)
6. Potassium: Monitor K+ intake *avoid salt substitute
7. Phosphorus: avoiding foods w/ added phosphate additives
8. Handouts given: copy of labs, CKD diet
Session duration:45 min
In office face to face or telehealth: face to face
F/U requested: yes
Front office notified: yes
Meredith Sims RD, LD
